title.narrative: CSDR output 1: Civil society organisations strengthened to promote democracy and foster participatory and result-driven Government-CSO dialogue at all levels in Ukraine.

description.narrative:
1.1: Number of CSO Hubs specialised in democratisation - members of network.
1.3: CSO Hubs network strategy is developed in participatory way and adopted by members.
1.4. Number of CSO Hubs constituencies involved in the programme activities of CSO Hubs.
1.5.: Number of vulnerable groups representatives i.e. women. IDPs. Persons with Disabilities. minorities covered by the CSO Hubs activities.
1.6.: Number of successfully implemented CSO projects and initiatives

title.narrative: CSDR output 1: Civil society organisations strengthened to promote democracy and foster participatory and result-driven Government-CSO dialogue at all levels in Ukraine.

description.narrative:
1.1: Number of CSO Hubs specialised in democratisation - members of network.
1.3: CSO Hubs network strategy is developed in participatory way and adopted by members.
1.4. Number of CSO Hubs constituencies involved in the programme activities of CSO Hubs.
1.5.: Number of vulnerable groups representatives i.e. women. IDPs. Persons with Disabilities. minorities covered by the CSO Hubs activities.
1.6.: Number of successfully implemented CSO projects and initiatives

title.narrative: CSDR output 2: Capacities of human rights actors enhanced to promote and defend human rights in Ukraine;

description.narrative:
2.1.: Number of CSO hubs specialized in human rights – members of network.
2.2.: The extent to which the strategy of CSO hubs includes targeted interventions to involve and increase knowledge and skills of vulnerable groups.
2.3.: Number of CSO hubs applying HRBA in their programme work.
2.4.: Number of successfully implemented CSO projects and initiatives aimed at human rights promotion.
2.5.: Number of vulnerable groups representatives (i.e. women. IDPs. persons with disabilities. minorities) benefitting from implemented CSO projects and initiatives for HR promotion.
2.6. Number of alternative stakeholders’ reports to the international treaty bodies on various human rights issues prepared
2.7. Number of rights holders and duty bearers with skills and knowledge of civil society engagement in policy development and implementation

title.narrative: CSDR output 3: Enhanced civic youth engagement and youth participation in decision-making at all levels.

description.narrative:
3.1.: Numbers of youth workers who have skills and knowledge to work and engage youth in civic activities.
3.2.: Number of young men and women that build skills in civic activism.
3.3.: Number of right holders and duty bearers with knowledge and skills on mechanisms of youth engagement in policy development and implementation for democracy and human rights
3.4. Number of engaged formal youth CSOs and non-formal youth groups advocating for the rights of vulnerable groups. i.e. women. IDPs PwD. minorities
3.5.: Number of successfully implemented youth initiatives aimed at enhanced democracy and human rights.

title.narrative: Civil society has strong impact on the reform process in Ukraine, including in the regions, in the areas of democracy and human rights and they contributes to more inclusive, democratic and rights-based governance through enhanced capacity, better coordin

Civil society has strong impact on the reform process in Ukraine, including in the regions, in the areas of democracy and human rights and they contributes to more inclusive, democratic and rights-based governance through enhanced capacity, better coordin

comment.narrative:
More effective and accountable public institutions respond to the needs of all persons within the jurisdiction of Ukraine, especially the most vulnerable (also reflected in new UNDAF and CPD).
Civil society will have a stronger impact on the reform processes in the country including in the regions in the areas of democracy and human rights and will contribute to more inclusive, democratic and rights-based governance through enhanced capacity, better coordination and networking.

title.narrative: CPAP Output 5: Capacity of national and local authorities and CSOs to promote human rights, access to justice and rule of law and to increase transparency and accountability developed.
CPAP Output 5: Capacity of national and local authorities and CSOs to promote human rights, access to justice and rule of law and to increase transparency and accountability developed.
